---
title: "data.ts"
---

## High-level description
This code defines functions to generate fake FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) data bundles for male and female patients. It includes functions to create fake conditions, medications, and allergies, which are then combined into a bundle. The code is designed to provide mock data for testing or development purposes in a healthcare application context.

## Code Structure
The code is organized into several functions that generate different types of FHIR resources (Conditions, MedicationStatements, and AllergyIntolerances) and two main functions (`generateFakeBundleFemale` and `generateFakeBundleMale`) that combine these resources into a Bundle.

## Symbols

### `generateFakeBundleFemale`
#### Description
Generates a fake FHIR Bundle for a female patient, including conditions, medications, and allergies.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| patientId | string | The ID of the patient |
| practitionerId | string | The ID of the practitioner |

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| Bundle | Bundle | A FHIR Bundle containing fake patient data |

#### Internal Logic
1. Generates fake condition data using `generateFakeConditionData1`
2. Generates fake medication data using `generateFakeMedicationData1`
3. Generates fake allergy data using `generateFakeAllergyData1`
4. Combines all resources into a Bundle

### `generateFakeBundleMale`
#### Description
Generates a fake FHIR Bundle for a male patient, including conditions, medications, and allergies.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| patientId | string | The ID of the patient |
| practitionerId | string | The ID of the practitioner |

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| Bundle | Bundle | A FHIR Bundle containing fake patient data |

#### Internal Logic
Similar to `generateFakeBundleFemale`, but uses `generateFakeConditionData2` and `generateFakeMedicationData2` for male-specific data.

### `generateFakeConditionData1` and `generateFakeConditionData2`
#### Description
Generate arrays of fake Condition resources for female and male patients respectively.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| patientId | string | The ID of the patient |

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| Condition[] | Condition[] | An array of Condition resources |

### `generateFakeMedicationData1` and `generateFakeMedicationData2`
#### Description
Generate arrays of fake MedicationStatement resources for female and male patients respectively.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| patientId | string | The ID of the patient |

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| MedicationStatement[] | MedicationStatement[] | An array of MedicationStatement resources |

### `generateFakeAllergyData1`
#### Description
Generates an array of fake AllergyIntolerance resources.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| patientId | string | The ID of the patient |
| practitionerId | string | The ID of the practitioner |

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| AllergyIntolerance[] | AllergyIntolerance[] | An array of AllergyIntolerance resources |

## Dependencies
| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| @medplum/fhirtypes | Provides TypeScript types for FHIR resources |
| @faker-js/faker | Generates fake data for some fields |

## Notes
- The code uses hardcoded data for most of the fake resources, with some variation between male and female data sets.
- The `faker` library is used minimally, only for generating past dates in medication statements.
- The code assumes the existence of certain practitioners and locations, as referenced in the Condition resources.
- There's a potential for improvement in data variety and randomization to create more diverse fake datasets.
